abstract: The New Museum abandoned plans for group use of the large sensory deprivation tank in its new show of the work of Belgium-born artist Carsten Holler, after officials from the city's Department of Health told the museum that it needed city approval and a permit for such collective activities.
snippet: The New Museum abandoned plans for group use of the large sensory deprivation tank in its new show of the work of Belgium-born artist Carsten Holler, after officials from the city's Department of Health told the museum that it needed city approval...

headline.main: City Nixes New Museum's Group Soaking Sessions
headline.print_headline: Museum’s Tank Sessions No Longer a Group Affair
